intro: Airopsis glabra, commonly known as the smooth airopsis, is a marine red alga found in tropical and subtropical coastal waters. It belongs to the family Rhodomelaceae and is characterized by its leathery, ribbon-like thallus that is typically smooth and unbranched. The plant exhibits a dichotomous branching pattern, with the main axis splitting into two equal branches. Its color ranges from reddish-brown to dark brown, depending on the depth and light conditions. Airopsis glabra plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
